About This Project

Project Overview

This website presents a comprehensive analysis of U.S. airline performance data, examining flight delays, cancellations, and operational patterns across airlines and airports. The project was completed as part of DSAN 6300 coursework, demonstrating skills in:

  • Database design and SQL query development
  • Data analysis and statistical interpretation
  • Data visualization and storytelling
  • Web-based reporting with Quarto

Data Source

Dataset: Airline On-Time Performance and Causes of Delay

Provider: U.S. Department of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics

Time Period: April 2019

Records: 600,000+ individual flight records

The dataset includes detailed information about:

  • Flight dates, airlines, and routes
  • Departure and arrival times (scheduled vs. actual)
  • Delay durations and causes
  • Cancellation information and reasons
  • Airport and carrier identifiers

Official Source: https://www.transtats.bts.gov/

Methodology

Database Design

The analysis utilized a dimensional data model with:

  • Fact Table: al_perf containing flight performance metrics
  • Dimension Tables:
    • L_AIRLINE_ID: Airline names and codes
    • L_AIRPORT_ID / L_AIRPORT: Airport identifiers and locations
    • L_WEEKDAYS: Day of week mappings
    • L_CANCELATION: Cancellation reason codes

SQL Queries

Seven core SQL queries were developed and answer these specific questions:

  1. Maximum departure delays by airline
  2. Maximum early departures by airline
  3. Flight counts by day of week
  4. Airport with highest average departure delay
  5. Each airline’s worst-performing airport
  6. Total cancelled flights count
  7. Daily flight patterns with rolling averages

Analysis Tools

  • SQL: PostgreSQL for data querying and aggregation
  • R: Data manipulation and visualization
    • tidyverse for data wrangling
    • ggplot2 for visualization
    • kableExtra for formatted tables
  • Quarto: Website generation and publishing

Key Findings Summary

System Volume

  • 106,575 flights on the busiest day (Monday)
  • Clear weekday/weekend pattern driven by business travel
  • Daily volumes range from ~85,000 to ~107,000 flights

Delays

  • Maximum delay: 2,620 minutes (43+ hours)
  • Southwest Oregon Regional (OTH): 47-minute average delay
  • Extreme variability between routine operations and worst-case scenarios

Cancellations

  • 14,488 flights cancelled in April 2019
  • Weather is the dominant cause at most airports
  • Approximately 2% cancellation rate overall

Project Structure

DSAN_6300_MINI_PROJECT/
├── index.qmd                  # Homepage
├── analysis.qmd               # Full analysis with visualizations
├── about.qmd                  # This page
├── _quarto.yml                # Website configuration
├── styles.css                 # Custom styling
└── SQL_exports/               # Query results
    ├── Problem01.csv          # Max delays by airline
    ├── Problem02.csv          # Early departures
    ├── Problem03.csv          # Day of week patterns
    ├── Problem04.csv          # Worst airport overall
    ├── Problem05.csv          # Worst airport per airline
    ├── Problem06a.csv         # Cancellation counts
    ├── Problem06b.csv         # Cancellation reasons
    └── Problem07.csv          # Daily flight patterns
